metadata.title: CVE-2018-20763 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In GPAC 0.7.1 and earlier, gf_text_get_utf8_line inmedia_tools/text_import.c in libgpac_static.a allows an out-of-bounds writebecause of missing szLineConv bounds checking.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
gpac-modules-base - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
libgpac2 - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gpac package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1').
